content.description: Start on some low jugs and move up and right using a pinch and some edges up to a big jug. Then go up on some flakes to another big jug and then make a committing move up to a horn and top it out.
content.location: This is the longest route up the middle of the face of Brown Glass Wall. Start on a chalked jug rail.

content.description: Go up the slab using pebbles and a few small holds up to the roof. Pull over the roof using some decent holds , then into the crack/flake system and up. Finish early to the right under the upper bulge or finish by going left and up through the final, 35 foot high bulge.
content.location:
This is on the right side of the big, west-facing wall. It is just to the right of

Right V

.

content.description: Fun slab climbing on the face leads to a stance under the roof in the horizontal crack. Use a good mini-jug in the face of the overhang (left of the 2 main cracks) to reach very far,- up and left, to a decent, diagonal, jug system. After turning the lip, I still found the climbing thought provoking and physically challenging still. Entire second half is exposed and can be reachy. Graded a V1-X, aka old school Colorado 5.11a.
content.location: It is on the Brown Glass Wall in the middle of the left side. This is left of 2 big cracks that split the roof in the middle.
